availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Timothy B. Pool (Christian/ Caldwell co. farmer + physician )

body.p: Christian County and Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer and physician. North Carolina native. Married to Mary L. Brown Pool in Christian County, Kentucky, on June 20, 1822. Father of John W. Pool, Robert M. Pool, Margaret A. Pool, Mary Barcorn Pool, and James Pool. Farmer in Christian County in 1850. Physician in Caldwell County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Caldwell County in 1860. Employed one enslaved person owned by Mrs. E. Williams.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, District 1, p. 462A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 64.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 221B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Christian County Marriages, Film #000465562.
"Dr Timothy Brown Pool (1802-1883)," Find A Grave, Memorial #152985347, accessed June 16, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/152985347.
